Hi, using the endpoint to batch create properties, I get this error when trying to create a calculated property:
> numberDisplayHint must be ‘duration’ for a time-between property
I’m passing these values in the call. Any ideas or does this require more context? The names of referenced fields in the calculationFormula are correct.
```{
      "name": "days_in_nurture",
      "label": "Days in nurture",
      "type": "number",
      "fieldType": "calculation_equation",
      "description": "",
      "groupName": "nurturing_data",
      "displayOrder": -1,
      "calculated": true,
      "archived": false,
      "hasUniqueValue": false,
      "hidden": false,
      "showCurrencySymbol": false,
      "formField": false,
      "calculationFormula": "time_between(date__enrolled, date__exited)"
    },```

I want to create a landing page that enables users to input data. Theb i want this data to be added to a hubdb table.
 
What is the best approach to do so?

Hi Christopher Chiha! 1) Create a HubDB table in HubSpot to store the data collected from the landing page. 2) Create a form on the landing page to collect the necessary data from the user. 3) Send the data to HubSpot using the Forms API, including the HubDB table ID and column names. 4)The data can be displayed on the landing page using HubDB's dynamic content functionality.

Are both the date_enrolled and date__exited date properties?
Not really, HubSpot reports can't pull data from outside data sources (yet), but if you setup a property then you could pull that information into a HubSpot report

One option for this would be to setup a github to HubSpot code integration. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/github-integration> And then have part of the github action be sending a notification to the slack channel
(You could also just do this with a zapier/make, which watches for changes in the github)
Unfortunately currently no
That's a correct response
what are you expecting?
Yeah unfortunately no, the best you can do is to just page through the results and then reverse them afterwards
You can definitely add data to a HubDB table but I'm a little confused by what you mean by "all the contents of a blog".
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/hubdb>
This api will update the table:
No the search api is limited to returning 10,000 results per search

you have a couple of options:
1. use the normal object api and get all the deals and then filter them after pulling all of them.
2. Export the deals from HubSpot and then filter them
I solve it
thankds

Yeah the search api doesn't support returning associations. You can use the normal email endpoint (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/email>) and pull the associated company using the association parameter
you could also use the associations api and request the associations for each result returned from the search response (you can also batch these requests)
of course
